text: today's recipe is kind of fun because
you can make it in the morning and then
finish it in the evening for a great
quick meal it's a crispy shrimp that's
baked in the oven with a cabbage slaw to
start off with you can oil a baking
sheet use about a tablespoon of
vegetable oil don't use olive oil for
this recipe and then to get your
breading ready I have one and a half
cups of panko add two teaspoons of sweet
paprika and then just stir it around a
little bit that's gonna be your breading
set that aside then for the egg portion
of your coating 2 large eggs this is
gonna make the bread crumb stick some
salt and pepper and whisk together in
this bowl I have 1/2 cup of flour and to
that I'm adding 1 pound of large shrimp
these are tail on you can take the tail
off if you don't like it toss with the
flour so it gets nice and coated then
the egg then the breadcrumbs really nice
and coated and then onto your oiled
baking sheet before you get these into
the oven you want to dab them with just
a little bit of oil
this helps with the browning get these
right into a 475 degree preheated oven
and cook them until they're golden brown
and crispy about 12 minutes while you're
waiting for your shrimp to cook you can
make some slaw I'm using red cabbage
today you could certainly use white
cabbage or savoy or whatever you want
very thinly shred it you're going to
need about 5 cups total half of a red
onion make it nice and thin and use as
little or as much as you like then you
can make your dressing you're going to
combine everything right in the bowl
juice of one lemon teaspoon of Dijon
mustard salt and pepper of course and
then two more tablespoons of vegetable
oil to give that a whisk with very
simple dressing add your vegetables and
give it a toss all right we're ready
look at these beauties
you can easily double or triple this if
you're serving a lot of people and then
some of the slaw and there you have it
it's a whole meal it's make-ahead
it's magnificent
